intro: Hypericum erectum var. divaricatum, commonly known as the creeping St. John's wort, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It features upright stems that often sprawl and form dense mats, with opposite, narrow, dark green leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish-orange flowers with five petals, typically blooming from June to August. Its medicinal properties are similar to other Hypericum species, containing hypericin and pseudohypericin. It is often used in traditional medicine for its purported antidepressant and antiviral effects.
